cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles west of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest along the Florida west coast today, then turning north and northeast across north-central Florida Wednesday before tracking up the southeastern U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Steinhatchee/Cedar Key area)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Egmont Key to Steinhatchee River, FL.  Tropical Storm Watch: West of Ochlockonee River to Indian Pass, FL and Mouth of St. Marys River, GA to South Santee River, SC.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Florida Keys (Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas) and Florida west coast from Flamingo to Ochlockonee River.  Storm Surge Warning: Bonita Beach to Aucilla River including Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast from the Keys to the Big Bend, then inland across southeast Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible Wednesday as Elsa’s rain bands cross the peninsula; sustained tropical-storm winds are unlikely (≤6% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of south-east Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with isolated amounts up to 6 inches, producing localized flash/urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible in outer rain bands; hazardous marine conditions with squalls and rough seas.
